comment: The predicate " ` F ` is a real-valued measurable function w.r.t. to the sigma-algebra ` S ` ". A function is measurable iff the preimages of all open intervals unbounded below are in the subspace sigma-algebra induced by its domain. The domain of ` F ` is required to be a subset of the underlying set of ` S ` . Definition 121C of [Fremlin1] p. 36, and Proposition 121B (i) of [Fremlin1] p. 35 . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 26-Jun-2021.)
